content.1: Welcome to https://phcpay.me, a user interface hosted on a website (the ”Interface” or ”App”) provided by Phuket Holiday Coin Limited, company incorporated in the Republic of Seychelles n. 226566 at House of Francis, Room 303, Ile Du Port, Mahe Glacis, Seychelles, SC, 188976 (”we”, ”our” or ”us”). The interface provides access to a decentralized protocol on Binance Smart Chain that allows suppliers of certain digital assets to participate in standalone interest rate markets as well as liquidity pool-based trading mechanisms (the ”Protocol”).
content.2: This Terms of Service Agreement (the ''Agreement'') explains the terms and conditions under which you may access and use the Interface. You must read this Agreement carefully. By accessing or using the Interface, you declare that you have read, understood and agreed to be bound by this Agreement in its entirety. If you disagree, you are not authorized to access or use the interface.
content.3: This document is intended to formalize the acceptance by RECEIVE to become a partner of the Phuket Holiday Coin Pay - PHCP Crypto System.
content.4: The receive confirms its willingness to enter the Phuket Holiday Coin payment ecosystem circuit with its dedicated PHCP currency, through its dedicated wallet https://phcpay.me

content.1: We reserve the right, in our sole discretion, to amend this Agreement from time to time. If we make any changes, we will notify you by updating the date at the top of the Agreement and by maintaining a current version of the Agreement at https://phcpay.me/terms. All changes will be effective when they are posted and your continued use of the interface will serve as confirmation of your acceptance of those changes. If you disagree with any changes to this Agreement, you must immediately stop accessing and using the Interface.

We will do our best to resolve any disputes through informal and good faith negotiations. If a potential dispute arises, you should contact us by sending an email to contact@phcpay.me so that we can attempt to resolve it without resorting to formal dispute resolution. If we are unable to reach an informal resolution within sixty days of your email, you and we both agree to resolve the potential dispute according to the procedure described below. Any claim or dispute arising out of or relating to the Interface, this Agreement, or any other act or omission for which you may hold that we are liable, including (but not limited to) any arbitration claim or dispute (” Dispute ”), will be definitively and exclusively resolved by arbitration pursuant to the Arbitration Procedures. You understand that you are required to resolve all disputes by binding arbitration. The arbitration will be held confidentially before a single arbitrator. The arbitration will be held in the Seyshelles Islands, unless you and we agree to hold it elsewhere. Unless otherwise agreed, the arbitrator cannot consolidate your claims with those of any other party. 17.topic: 16. Class Action and renunciation of the jury trial

content.1: You must bring any dispute against us individually and not as a plaintiff or member of any alleged class action, class action, private lawsuit or other representative proceeding. This provision applies to class arbitration. You and both agree to waive the right to request a jury trial.

You agree that the laws of the Seyshelles Islands, regardless of conflict of law principles, govern this Agreement and any dispute between you and us. You further agree that the Interface is deemed to be based solely in the British Virgin Islands and that although the Interface may be available in other jurisdictions, its availability does not give rise to general or specific personal jurisdiction in any forum outside the British Virgin Islands. . Any arbitration conducted under this Agreement will be governed by federal arbitration law. You agree that the Seyshelles Islands are the appropriate forum for any appeal against an arbitration award or for legal proceedings in the event that the binding arbitration clause of this Agreement is found to be unenforceable.
